page.title: 13THE BASS INVERURIE
page.content:
At the foot of the Bass stood a Kirk (Church) but it has disappeared. However, in the cemetry which is situated round the Bass, there are a number of old gravestones including four Pictish stones.
One of the old gravestones is the "Marjorie Elphinstone Tombstone". The stone bears the date 1620 and the added inscription "from the inside wall of old church". The story of Marjorie Elphinstone is that she was buried in the churchyard twice. The first time grave robbers were cutting off her finger to steal her ring when she came alive again and sent them running off petrified. She had been buried unconscious, not dead.
